algorithm_technique: Level-order traversal (BFS) with alternating reversal of node values per level
problem_summary_simple: Traverse a binary tree level by level, alternating direction (left-to-right, then right-to-left).
problem_summary_technical: Performs BFS, collecting node values per level and reversing the list of values for odd-numbered levels.
key_insights: Standard BFS is used to process nodes level by level.
The key is to reverse the collected values for every other level.
The `len(result) % 2` condition efficiently determines whether to reverse the current level's values.
